intro: Caroxylon calluna, commonly known as heather, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North America, typically growing in acidic, well-drained soils. The plant features dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Its evergreen leaves are narrow and leathery, contributing to its hardy nature. Caroxylon calluna is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in challenging environments.
